conditions.rails: Rails approximately 10 yards off inner line
conditions.weatherComment: 25mm 24th - 31st. Dry overnight. Forecast to be dry throughout the day. 14C.
conditions.other:
COVID PROCEDURES
All attendees will be required to demonstrate their COVID status by providing proof of one of the following;
- You have been fully vaccinated (two doses) - via the NHS COVID Pass
- You have completed a negative Lateral Flow Test (LFT) within 48 hours of attending, ideally within 12 hours - via the NHS COVID Pass, or a valid text or email confirmation from NHS Test & Trace
- You are exempt based on approved medical exemption

Getting a Digital COVID Pass:
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/get-digital-covid-pass/

There will be no Lateral Flow Testing available on site

RACING STAFF
Proof of COVID status will be required prior to unloading. Please ensure you have your NHS COVID Pass ready for screening at the dedicated arrival lane

FACE COVERINGS
Must be worn by all in former Green Zone including the Weighing Room, Pre Parade and Parade Ring, horse walks, stables, saddling boxes and at the start

conditions.weatherComment: 1mm rain overnight. A mainly dry day with some sunny periods, a 12mph SW wind and a high of 10c
conditions.other:
FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of 3 1/2" and reinstated with a gallopmaster finish.

conditions.weatherComment: Early evening light showers followed by a slight ground frost this morning. Today should be dry with sunny intervals, a 10mph NW wind & a high of 6c
conditions.other:
FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track was left open overnight. It will be harrowed to a depth of 3" this morning and reinstated with a gallop master finish

Rails on all bends and hurdles moved out to fresh ground. Extra Distances -
2mH, 2mNHF + 96yds; 2m6fH + 143yds; 2mCH +70yds; 2m5fCH +103yds; 3mCH +140yds.
conditions.weatherComment:
Thursday 3mm; Friday 3mm; Saturday 2mm: Sunday 7mm; Monday 6mm; Tuesday 2mm;
Forecast - Wednesday Mostly dry and some occasional cloud, slight chance wintery light showers late afternoon (1mm) 6*.
conditions.other:
ENHANCED PRIZEMONEY with this and all our Fixtures through to March offering at least £75k a day.
Please note that we have drained the home straight with 2m sand slits this summer, some scarring is still visual, though ground is level and consistent throughout 

Owners are allowed four badges per horse. There are strictly no additions this number.  



Owners of winning and placed horses will be able to access the Winners’ Enclosure after the race but admission to the Parade Ring before the race will not be possible. Face masks must be worn in the Winners’ Enclosure.

For further information, please contact our Owners Relationship Manager, Martin Higgs on 07831 752056 or email mhiggs@chepstow-racecourse.co.uk

conditions.weatherComment:
5mm Sunday
2mm Monday
7mm Tuesday
Dry and bright yesterday.
Forecast: 
+2C this morning, staying dry until midday, light rain to start and continue on and off throughout the afternoon, heavier showers after 3pm (3-6mm) highs 5C.
conditions.other:
ENHANCED PRIZEMONEY with this and all our Fixtures through to March offering at least £75k a day
RACING BEHIND CLOSED DOORS 
Owners are allowed four badges per horse. There are strictly no additions this number.  
The meeting is taking place Behind Closed Doors on instruction from the Welsh Government and there are limitations on the number of attendees coming to the fixture in a working capacity.
Please use the RCA PASS system to register your badges. It is important to use PASS because we are not in a position to take bookings over the phone.
All owners should park in the main car park and on arrival present their Covid Pass or negative lateral flow test (taken within 24 hours of the fixture). Unfortunately we cannot allow anyone into the course who does not comply by these regulations issued by the Welsh Government.
Face masks must when worn inside buildings and we actively encourage you to wear them when outdoors. Social distancing rules apply.

conditions.rails: The 'away' chase bend has been pushed out 14 yards from its innermost line. The 'away' hurdle bend has been pushed out 14yds from its innermost line. The shared 'A1' bend has been pushed out 25yds from its innermost line. Race distances increased as per the summary.
conditions.weatherComment:
Dry & breezy on Saturday & Sunday AM. 3mm rain on Sunday PM. Dry, bright and strong winds on Monday. 3.5mm rain overnight into Tuesday morning followed by a cool, clear and sunny day. Wednesday was another clear and bright day and night, with a low of -3C overnight into Thursday. 0.6mm rain during Thursday afternoon, followed by a further 7mm rain / sleet overnight, making 7.5mm in the last 24hrs. Overnight low temp of +1C.
Forecast: Possibility of some further light rain / sleet through until about 9am, then clearing to leave a dry day, with some sunny spells and top temp of +4C.
conditions.other: Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)

data.weather: Dry & breezy on Saturday & Sunday AM. 3mm rain on Sunday PM. Dry, bright and strong winds on Monday. 3.5mm rain overnight into Tuesday morning followed by a cool, clear and sunny day. Wednesday was another clear and bright day and night, with a low of -3C overnight into Thursday. 0.6mm rain during Thursday afternoon, followed by a further 7mm rain / sleet overnight, making 7.5mm in the last 24hrs. Overnight low temp of +1C. Forecast: Possibility of some further light rain / sleet through until about 9am, then clearing to leave a dry day, with some sunny spells and top temp of +4C.
data.other: Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)

conditions.other:
FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of about 3" and reinstated with a gallopmaster finish.

conditions.other:
FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of 3 1/2" and  reinstated with a gallopmaster finish.

FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.

conditions.rails:
Winning line through to Exeter Bend out by between 5yds - 7yds from innermost position. 
A shared Exeter bend increases hurdle distance, and reduces Chase distance. 
Separate Plymouth home-turn bend, Chase out by 10yds, Hurdle out by 6yds. All hurdles remain in central positions.

conditions.goingStickComment: GOINGSTICK information will be updated once leaf frost has cleared
conditions.weatherComment: Dry again overnight, very light leaf frost over the past two hours and temperatures already rising, partly cloudy day ahead with some sunshine, top temperatures of 7'c.
conditions.other:
FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.  Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing. Any Travelers/Companions that have not run in the previous four
days or are not entered to run in the next four days will be
charged for at £20 + VAT
conditions.lowSunProvision: Low sun could result in obstacle omission at this fixture

conditions.groundComment: Racing Goes Ahead Going Ratio; 50:50. Frost covers were deployed on take-off, landing and vulnerable areas on Wednesday.
conditions.rails:
The Chase Course is 4 yards out and the Winter Hurdle Course is 8 yards out from there innermost
configuration, with the effect on distances added to race distance details.
conditions.weatherComment:
We had a sharp frost overnight which recorded -3.5C air temperature and -4.5C on the ground. Current temp is 0C.
A frosty and foggy morning with maximum temp +7C.
conditions.other:
COVID-19 GUIDELINES
As part of our efforts to make the raceday experience as safe as possible, attendees aged 18 and over
will be required to hold a valid NHS COVID Pass or be in possession of valid communication providing
proof of 1 of the following:
The attendee is double vaccinated with an approved vaccine
The attendee has tested negative on a Lateral Flow or PCR test within the last 48 hours and ideally
within 12 hours.
The attendee is exempt on the basis of medical exemption or clinical trial participation
Checks will be in operation at the racecourse with dedicated stewards checking spectators and staff
prior to entry.
Please have your NHS COVID Pass ready should you be requested to show this.
Thank you for your continued support and co-operation.
conditions.inspectionComment: Further Inspection at 11.20am due to FOG

conditions.groundComment: RACING GOES AHEAD
conditions.rails:
INNER Hurdle Track. 
Shared Sainsburys & Reservoir bends on Innermost.
Split stable bend.
conditions.weatherComment:
Overnight temps fell to -2C. Grass frost this AM. Foggy start, before lifting with temps rising to 5C by midday. Overcast throughout racing. 
Frost sheets deployed on landing/take-offs & vulnerable areas.
conditions.other:
Industry Plan B Covid measures and enforced face coverings apply for this fixture. This includes all former green zone areas including the weighing room, pre-parade & parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (Inc. jockeys).

ALL WEIGHING ROOM PERSONNEL - A negative LFT result will be required for weighing room access. Check in station will be located outside of the weighing room.
conditions.inspectionComment: Currently raceable, potential for a further frost overnight. Forecast for plus 7C by lunchtime.

conditions.weatherComment:
32mm since last meeting on 29/12
Wednesday: Dry and bright, still quite breezy but feeling quite mild. Maximum temperature 9 °C.
Thursday: A mostly dry day but some fog patches may be slow to clear in the west. Maximum temperature 9 °C.
Outlook: Remaining settled overall but some low cloud, fog patches and drizzly rain on Friday with light winds. Brighter on Saturday and becoming colder later on Sunday with winds turning northwesterly.
ALL WEIGHING ROOM PERSONNEL - A negative LFT result will be required for weighing room access.

26mm since last meeting on 29/12
Wednesday:  dry bright day with some long sunny spells, A rather cold day, the moderate to fresh northwest breeze easing down. Maximum/Minimum temperature 4°C/-4°C#
Thursday: A dry start for most but rain on west coast spreading east with snow on high ground, becoming confined to hills in afternoon. Frequent wintry showers overnight, some snowfalls. Maximum temperature 6 °C.

conditions.other:
FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of 4" & reinstated with a gallopmaster finish.

conditions.rails:
Winning line through to Exeter Bend out by up to 12yds from innermost position. 
A shared Exeter bend increases hurdle distance, and reduces Chase distance. 
Separate Plymouth home-turn bend, Chase remains out by 10yds, Hurdle out by 7yds. All hurdles remain in central positions.
conditions.weatherComment:
Dry and settled last 7 days, 1mm Sunday.
Temperatures 9c today.
conditions.other: The weighing room entrance will be reduced to the main front door only, to pass through our screening process. Everyone entering the Weighing Room complex will be required to present on arrival evidence of a negative Lateral Flow Test (LFT).

data.going: ABANDONED - Frozen (Day of Racing) Racing Abandoned Following frost overnight and three inspections this morning, it was decided that racing should be abandoned. A selection of trainers, jockeys and officials were present for the final inspection and their views were sought in determining the outcome.

conditions.weatherComment: Dry overnight. A cloudy and mainly dry day with a light W wind & a high of 7c
conditions.other:
FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of 3" and reinstated with a gallopmaster finish.

data.other: FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering. TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road. conditions.weatherComment: Dry overnight. A cloudy dry day is expected with a light S wind & a high of 5c.
conditions.other:
FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of 3 1/2" and reinstated with a gallopmaster finish.

conditions.groundComment: Strong winds overnight into Thursday, course may well feel tacky & gluey in areas now.
conditions.rails: We will be operating the 'away' bend as a shared chase and hurdle bend at this fixture.  Therefore, the steeplechase races will be on a line pushed out 19 yards from its the 'official' line, while the  hurdle races will be on a line 5yds in from the 'official' line. The 'A1' bend has been pushed out 30yds from its innermost line. Race distances increased as per the summary.
conditions.weatherComment:
Dry, cold and sunny on Friday. Frost overnight into Saturday, then a cold and clear day.  Cloudy overnight into Sunday and a calm and cloudy day on Sunday. Calm, cloudy and overcast all day Monday. Dry & cold on Tuesday. Dry overnight into Wednesday and warmer and cloudy on Wednesday afternoon, with a stiff breeze. Dry, warmer and very strong winds overnight into Thursday.
Forecast: Winds due to recede as the morning passes, then dry and bright day on Thursday. 10C.
conditions.other:
The requirement for all Participants who need weighing room access to undertake a LATERAL FLOW TEST on the morning of racing, and submit their results to the NHS website, currently remains in operation at Wetherby. Please ensure you have your results to hand when you first arrive at the Weighing Room entrance.

Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)

conditions.rails: We will be operating the 'away' bend as a shared chase and hurdle bend at this fixture.  Therefore, the steeplechase races will be on a line pushed out 19 yards from its the 'official' line, while the  hurdle races will be on a line 5yds in from the 'official' line. The 'A1' bend has been pushed out 30yds from its innermost line. Race distances increased as per the summary.
conditions.weatherComment:
Dry, cold and sunny on Friday. Frost overnight into Saturday, then a cold and clear day.  Cloudy overnight into Sunday and a calm and cloudy day on Sunday. Calm, cloudy and overcast all day Monday.
Forecast: Possible frost overnight into Tuesday, otherwise mostly dry and overcast days throughout this week, with day time temps hitting 10C on Thursday.  Very modest chance of rain shower on Wednesday and relatively calm week wind wise.
conditions.other:
The requirement for all Participants who need weighing room access to undertake a LATERAL FLOW TEST on the morning of racing, and submit their results to the NHS website, currently remains in operation at Wetherby. Please ensure you have your results to hand when you first arrive at the Weighing Room entrance.

Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)
conditions.bookingComment: No overnight accommodation available onsite, but off-site accommodation can be arranged if required. However, given current Covid situation please email jonjo@wetherbyracing.co.uk ASAP to assist with the booking process.

data.weather: Dry, cold and sunny on Friday. Frost overnight into Saturday, then a cold and clear day. Cloudy overnight into Sunday and a calm and cloudy day on Sunday. Calm, cloudy and overcast all day Monday. Dry & cold on Tuesday. Dry overnight into Wednesday and warmer and cloudy on Wednesday afternoon, with a stiff breeze. Dry, warmer and very strong winds overnight into Thursday. Forecast: Winds due to recede as the morning passes, then dry and bright day on Thursday. 10C.

conditions.weatherComment: A mainly cloudy day with a 10mph SW wind & a high of 9c
conditions.other:
TRACK MAINTENANCE. The track will be harrowed to a depth of 3 1/2" and reinstated with a gallopmaster finish.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
WEIGHING ROOM ACCESS. Proof of a negative lateral flow test will be required for access to the weighing room, where social distancing measures remain in place. The wearing of masks is highly recommended too.

FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
